intro: Arytera macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited spurge, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa. The plant is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and leaves that are typically lance-shaped. Its most distinctive feature is its large, yellow-orange berries, which are covered in a waxy coating. Arytera macrocarpa is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and drought tolerance.
